question:
The name for CH3CHBrCHClCH2CH3 is
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. dibromotrichloropropane
B. dibromotrichloropentane
C. 2-bromo, 3-chloropentane
D. 2,3-bromochloropentane
Answer:

If 1.0 g of rubidium and 1.0 g of bromine are reacted, what will be left in measurable amounts (more than 0.10 mg) in the reaction vessel?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. RbBr only
B. RbBr and Rb only
C. RbBr and Br2 only
D. RbBr, Rb, and Br2
Answer:

Which of the following is a radioactive element?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. Na
B. Cr
C. Am
D. Al
Answer:

How many milliliters of 0.250 M KOH does it take to neutralize completely 50.0 mL of 0.150 M H3PO4?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. 30.0 mL
B. 27 mL
C. 90.0 mL
D. 270 mL
Answer:

The dimerization of NO2(g) to N2O4(g) is an endothermic process. Which of the following will, according to Le Châtelier's principle, increase the amount of N2O4 in a reaction vessel?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. Decreasing the temperature
B. Increasing the size of the reaction vessel
C. Adding a selective catalyst
D. Making the reaction vessel smaller
Answer:

Which of the following is the strongest Brønsted-Lowry acid?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. HBrO
B. HBrO3
C. HBrO2
D. HBrO4
Answer:

Which of the following does not contain oxygen?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. An aldehyde
B. An alkane
C. An alcohol
D. An ether
Answer:

What is the pH of a solution made by dissolving 0.0300 mol of sodium ethanoate in enough water to make 50 mL of solution (Ka for ethanoic acid is 1.8 × 10^-5)?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. 7
B. 9.26
C. 4.74
D. 11.02
Answer:

What is an alpha particle?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. Another name for an electron
B. Another name for a helium nucleus
C. Another name for a positron
D. Another name for a cosmic ray
Answer:

Starting with a stock solution of 18.0 M H2SO4, what is the proper procedure to create a 1.00 L sample of a 3.0 M solution of H2SO4 in a volumetric flask?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. Add 167 mL of the stock solution to the flask, then fill the flask the rest of the way with distilled water while swirling the solution.
B. Add 600 mL of the stock solution to the flask, then fill the flask the rest of the way with distilled water while swirling the solution.
C. Fill the flask partway with water, then add 167 mL of the stock solution, swirling to mix it. Last, fill the flask the rest of the way with distilled water.
D. Fill the flask partway with water, then add 600 mL of the stock solution, swirling to mix it. Last, fill the flask the rest of the way with distilled water.
Answer:

When will Kp and Kc have the same numerical value?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. At absolute zero for all reactions
B. When the concentrations are at standard state
C. When the concentrations are all 1.00 molar
D. When the reaction exhibits no change in pressure at constant volume
Answer:

2Ag+(aq) + Fe(s) → 2Ag(s) + Fe2+(aq) Which of the following would cause an increase in potential in the voltaic cell described by the above reaction?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. Increasing [Fe2+]
B. Adding more Fe(s)
C. Decreasing [Fe2+]
D. Removing some Fe(s)
Answer:

The oxidation number of chlorine in the perchlorate ion, ClO4–, is
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. 2
B. -3
C. -1
D. 7
Answer:

When potassium perchlorate, KClO4, dissolves in water, the temperature of the resultant solution is lower than the initial temperature of the components. Which of the following conclusions may be related to this?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. This is a spontaneous process because it is exothermic.
B. This is a spontaneous process because of an entropy increase.
C. This is a spontaneous process because of an entropy decrease.
D. This is a spontaneous process because it is exothermic.
Answer:

The bond length between any two nonmetal atoms is achieved under which of the following conditions?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. Where the energy of interaction between the atoms is at its minimum value
B. Where the nuclei of each atom exhibits the strongest attraction to the electrons of the other atom
C. The point at which the attractive and repulsive forces between the two atoms are equal
D. The closest point at which a valence electron from one atom can transfer to the other atom
Answer:

An ester is made by reacting
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. an amine and an alcohol
B. two different alcohols
C. an alcohol and an acid
D. an acid and a base
Answer:

What is the molecular mass of a gas that has a density of 2.05 g/L at 26.0 °C and 722 torr?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. 53.0 g/mol
B. 46.7 g/mol
C. 4.67 g/mol
D. 2876 g/mol
Answer:

Which of the following indicates that a reaction is spontaneous?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. at equilibrium there are more products than reactants
B. the value of ΔG° is greater than zero
C. the value of ΔS° is greater than zero
D. the value of Keq is less than one
Answer:

Sulfur dioxide reacts with oxygen to form sulfur trioxide in the presence of a catalyst. The equilibrium constant, Kp, at a certain temperature is 3.0 × 10^22. A 2.0-liter flask has enough SO3 added to it to produce a pressure of 0.789 atm Hg. After the reaction comes to equilibrium, the expected partial pressure of O2 will be
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. 2.88 × 10^-6 torr
B. 3 × 10^-18 mm Hg
C. 1100 mm Hg
D. 1.32 × 10^-5 torr
Answer:

Carbon exists in various forms called allotropes. Which of the following is not an allotrope of carbon?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. diamond
B. soot
C. buckminsterfullerene
D. graphite
Answer:

During the investigation of a chemical reaction by a chemistry student, she was able to determine that the reaction was nonspontaneous at 1 atm and 298 K. However, she learned that cooling the system with dry ice (-78°C) caused the reaction to become spontaneous. Which of the following combinations must apply to this reaction?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. ΔH < 0, ΔS < 0, and ΔG = 0
B. ΔH > 0, ΔS < 0, and ΔG > 0
C. ΔH < 0, ΔS < 0, and ΔG > 0
D. ΔH > 0, ΔS > 0, and ΔG > 0
Answer:

Hypochlorous acid is an unstable compound, and one of the decomposition products is chlorine gas, Cl2. The decomposition of the acid lowers its concentration over time. What effect will the decomposition of one-fourth of the acid have on the agreement between the endpoint of the titration and the equivalence point during a titration with standard sodium hydroxide?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. The endpoint would still remain near the ideal equivalence point.
B. The endpoint would be after the ideal equivalence point.
C. The endpoint would be before the ideal equivalence point.
D. It is impossible to determine.
Answer:

The rate law may be written using stoichiometric coefficients for which of the following?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. Precipitation reactions
B. Acid-base reactions
C. Elementary processes
D. Solubility reactions
Answer:

Iron(III) hydroxide has Ksp = 1.6 × 10^-39. What is the molar solubility of this compound?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. 8.8 × 10^-11 M
B. 2.0 × 10^-10 M
C. 7.4 × 10^-14 mol/L
D. 9.4 × 10^-6 mol/L
Answer:

The first ionization energy for a neutral atom of chlorine is 1.25 MJ/mol and the first ionization energy for a neutral atom of argon is 1.52 MJ/mol. How would the first ionization energy value for a neutral atom of potassum compare to those values?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. It would be greater than both because potassium carries a greater nuclear charge then either chlorine or argon.
B. It would be greater than both because the size of a potassium atom is smaller than an atom of either chlorine or argon.
C. It would be less than both because there are more electrons in potassium, meaning they repel each other more effectively and less energy is needed to remove one.
D. It would be less than both because a valence electron of potassium is farther from the nucleus than one of either chlorine or argon.
Answer:

In acid solution the bromate ion, BrO3- can react with other substances, resulting in Br2. Balance the half-reaction for bromate ions forming bromine. The balanced half-reaction has
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. 6 electrons on the left
B. 6 electrons on the right
C. 3 electrons on the left
D. 10 electrons on the left
Answer:

Dissolving one mole of each of the following compounds in water results in solutions with different pH values. Under those conditions, which of the following acids will have the highest percentage ionization?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. HNO2
B. HClO4
C. H2S
D. H3PO4
Answer:

A sample of solid MgCl2 would be most soluble in which of the following solutions?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. LiOH(aq)
B. CBr4(aq)
C. Mg(NO3)2(aq)
D. AlCl3(aq)
Answer:

Determine the H+(aq) concentration in 1.0 M phenol, C6H5OH, solution. (The Ka for phenol is 1 × 10^-10.)
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. 1 × 10^-10 M
B. 1 × 10^-9 M
C. 1 × 10^-3 M
D. 1 × 10^-5 M
Answer:

Examining data obtained from mass spectrometry supports which of the following?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. The common oxidation states of elements
B. Atomic size trends within the periodic table
C. Ionization energy trends within the periodic table
D. The existence of isotopes
Answer:

The Arrhenius equation may be used to determine
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. the activation energy of a reaction
B. the rate constant at various temperatures
C. the shelf life of a consumer product or drug
D. all of the above
Answer:

A solution is prepared by dissolving 30.0 grams of Ni(NO3)2 in enough water to make 250 mL of solution. What is the molarity of this solution?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. 0.496 molar
B. 0.656 mol/L
C. 3.3 molar
D. 6.3 × 10^-3 molar
Answer:

There are a number of experiments for the determination of the molecular mass of a gas. One method begins by heating a solid or liquid in a flask to produce a gaseous product. The gas passes through a tube and displaces water in an inverted, water-filled bottle. The mass of the starting material is measured, along with the volume of the displaced water and the temperature of the system. The pressure in the inverted water-filled bottle is equal to the external pressure. Once the barometric pressure has been recorded, what other information is needed to finish the experiment?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. The heat of formation of the gas
B. The density of the water
C. The mass of the displaced water
D. The vapor pressure of the water
Answer:

Which of the following is a balanced chemical reaction?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. Na2SO4 + Ba(NO3)2 → BaSO4 + NaSO4
B. AgNO3 + K2CrO4 → Ag2CrO4 + 2 KNO3
C. 5 FeCl2 + 8 HCl + KMnO4 → 5 FeCl3 + MnCl2 + 4 H2O + KCl
D. Al(NO3)3 + 3 KOH → Al(OH)3 + KNO3
Answer:

Hund's rule requires that
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. no two electrons can have the same four quantum numbers
B. no two electrons with the same spin can occupy an orbital
C. no two electrons can occupy separate orbitals
D. no two electrons can pair up if there is an empty orbital at the same energy level available
Answer:

Consider the Lewis structures for the following molecules: CO2, CO32-, NO2-, and NO3-. Which molecule would have the shortest bonds?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. CO2
B. CO32-
C. NO2-
D. NO3-
Answer:

A 25 g sample of a liquid was heated to 100 °C and then quickly transferred to an insulated container holding 100 g of water at 22 °C. The temperature of the mixture rose to reach a final temperature of 35 °C. Which of the following can be concluded?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. The sample temperature changed more than the water temperature did; therefore the sample lost more heat energy than the water gained.
B. The sample temperature changed more than the water temperature did, but the sample lost the same amount of heat energy as the water gained.
C. The sample temperature changed more than the water temperature did; therefore the CP of the sample must be greater than the CP of the water.
D. The final temperature is less than the average starting temperature of the sample and the water; therefore the total energy of the sample and water decreased.
Answer:

When collecting a gas over water, it is important to
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. set the temperature at 0°C
B. be sure the gas does not burn
C. wait until the barometer reads 760
D. correct for the vapor pressure of water
Answer:

When the dichromate ion is reacted, one of its most common products is Cr3+. What is the oxidation state (oxidation number) of chromium in the dichromate ion? Does reduction or oxidation occur when dichromate forms Cr3+?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. 3+, reduction
B. 12+, reduction
C. 6+, reduction
D. 6+, oxidation
Answer:

What is the pH of a solution prepared by dissolving 0.1665 mole of hypochlorous acid (HClO) in enough water to make 500 mL of solution? The Ka is 3.0 × 10^-4
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. 1
B. 2
C. 5.4 × 10^-3
D. 1.76
Answer:

The net ionic equation expected when solutions of NH4Br and AgNO3 are mixed together is
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. Ag+(aq) + Br-(aq) → AgBr(s)
B. NH4+(aq) + Ag+(aq) → Ag(NH4)3+2(aq)
C. Br-(aq) + NO3-(aq) → NO3Br(aq)
D. NH4Br(aq) + NO3-(aq) → NH4NO3(aq) + Br-(aq)
Answer:

Nitrous acid, HNO2, has a pKa value of 3.3. If a solution of nitrous acid is found to have a pH of 4.2, what can be said about the concentration of the conjugate acid/base pair found in solution?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. [HNO2] > [NO2-]
B. [NO2-] > [HNO2]
C. [H2NO2+] > [HNO2]
D. [HNO2] > [H2NO2+]
Answer:

Which of the following best explains why the ionization of atoms can occur during photoelectron spectroscopy, even though ionization is not a thermodynamically favored process?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. It is an exothermic process due to the release of energy as an electron is liberated from the Coulombic attraction holding it to the nucleus.
B. The entropy of the system increases due to the separation of the electron from its atom.
C. Energy contained in the light can be used to overcome the Coulombic attraction between electrons and the nucleus.
D. The products of the ionization are at a lower energy state than the reactants.
Answer:

When an ideal gas is allowed to expand isothermally, which one of the following is true?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. q = 0
B. w = 0
C. E = 0
D. q = -w
Answer:

A 2.35-gram sample was dissolved in water, and the chloride ions were precipitated by adding silver nitrate (Ag+ + Cl- → AgCl). If 0.435 g of precipitate was obtained, what is the percentage of chlorine in the sample?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. 10.80%
B. 4.60%
C. 43.50%
D. 18%
Answer:

Which of the following has an octet of electrons around the central atom?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. BF3
B. NH4+
C. PF5
D. SF6
Answer:

Atoms of four elements are examined: carbon, nitrogen, neon, and sulfur. Which element would have a photoelectron spectra in which the peak representing electrons with the lowest ionization energy would be three times higher than all other peaks?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. Carbon
B. Nitrogen
C. Neon
D. Sulfur
Answer:

You cannot prepare a buffer by
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. mixing a solution of a weak base with a strong acid
B. mixing a solution of a weak acid with a strong base
C. mixing a solution of a strong base with a strong acid
D. mixing a solution of a weak acid with its conjugate base
Answer:

A solution contains a mixture of four different compounds: KCl(aq), Fe(NO3)3(aq), MgSO4(aq), and N2H4(aq). Which of these compounds would be easiest to separate via distillation?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. KCl(aq)
B. Fe(NO3)3(aq)
C. MgSO4 (aq)
D. N2H4(aq)
Answer:

Which of the following substances has an asymmetrical molecular structure?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. SF4
B. PCl5
C. BF3
D. CO2
Answer:

SO2Cl2 → SO2(g) + Cl2(g) At 600 K, SO2Cl2 will decompose to form sulfur dioxide and chlorine gas via the above equation. If the reaction is found to be first order overall, which of the following will cause an increase in the half life of SO2Cl2?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. Increasing the initial concentration of SO2Cl2
B. Increasing the temperature at which the reaction occurs
C. Decreasing the overall pressure in the container
D. None of these will increase the half life
Answer:

The units for the rate of a chemical reaction are
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. L2 mol-2 s-1
B. mol L-1 s-1
C. L mol-1 s-1
D. it depends on the particular reaction
Answer:

A certain reaction is nonspontaneous under standard conditions, but becomes spontaneous at higher temperatures. What conclusions may be drawn under standard conditions?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. ΔH < 0, ΔS < 0 and ΔG = 0
B. ΔH > 0, ΔS < 0 and ΔG > 0
C. ΔH < 0, ΔS < 0 and ΔG > 0
D. ΔH > 0, ΔS > 0 and ΔG > 0
Answer:

Formation of a solution can often be visualized as a three-step process. Step 1. Solvent molecules are separated from each other to make space for the solute. Step 2. Solute molecules are separated so they fit into spaces in the solvent. Step 3. Separated solute and solvent are brought together filling in the spaces.All of the fundamental principles below are important in understanding the formation of solutions except which one?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. Starting at equilibrium, moving particles apart while in the solid or equilibrium phases requires added energy proportional to the attractive forces.
B. Bringing particles together releases energy in proportion to their attractive forces.
C. The total of the energies in steps 1 to 3 indicates if a solution will form.
D. Molecules with similar molecular masses are required to form solutions.
Answer:

Nitrous acid is a weak acid, while nitric acid is a much stronger acid because
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. the nitrogen in nitric acid is more electronegative than the nitrogen in nitrous acid
B. nitric acid has more oxygen atoms in its formula
C. the –O–H bonds in nitric acid are much weaker than in nitrous acid due to the electron withdrawing of more oxygen atoms on nitric acid
D. nitric acid has the hydrogen atoms bound directly to the nitrogen atom
Answer:

Which of the following is expected to have the largest bond polarity?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. S–O
B. P–F
C. C–B
D. C–N
Answer:

Your supervisor asks you to determine the enthalpy of a certain chemical reaction. Which would you do?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. Measure the ΔS and the ΔG for the reaction, and calculate the ΔH from the Gibbs free energy equation.
B. Use a bomb calorimeter to measure the heat of the reaction.
C. Use a solution calorimeter such as a coffee-cup calorimeter to measure the heat.
D. Use a photoelectron spectrometer to measure the energies of all atoms in the compounds, and use Hess's law to add them.
Answer:

An unknown substance is found to have a high melting point. In addition, it is a poor conductor of electricity and does not dissolve in water. The substance most likely contains
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. ionic bonding
B. nonpolar covalent bonding
C. covalent network bonding
D. metallic bonding
Answer:

Three half-lives after an isotope is prepared,
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. 25% of the isotope is left
B. 25% of the isotope decayed
C. 12.5% of the isotope is left
D. 12.5% of the isotope decayed
Answer:

Of the following, the most important experimental information used to deduce the structure of the atom was
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. the density of each element
B. the specific heat capacity
C. the emission spectrum of the elements, particularly hydrogen
D. the X-rays emitted from each element
Answer:

Under which conditions will a real gas most closely behave as an ideal gas?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. High temperature and high pressure
B. High temperature and low pressure
C. High volume and high temperature
D. Low temperature and low pressure
Answer:

A solution of sulfurous acid, H2SO3, is present in an aqueous solution. Which of the following represents the concentrations of three different ions in solution?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. [SO32-] > [HSO3-] > [H2SO3]
B. [H2SO3] > [HSO3-] > [SO32-]
C. [H2SO3] > [HSO3-] = [SO32-]
D. [SO32-] = [HSO3-] > [H2SO3]
Answer:

Of the following pairs of elements, which pair has the second element with the larger electronegativity based on its position in the periodic table?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. Oxygen, chromium
B. Chlorine, iodine
C. Calcium, cesium
D. Sulfur, nitrogen
Answer:

Silver metal, often amalgamated with mercury, is used to reduce substances to a desired oxidation state. If the silver metal amalgam cannot be used because of concerns about mercury, which of the following would be a reasonable and safe substitute?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. H+(aq)
B. Na(s)
C. Ca2+(aq)
D. Mg(s)
Answer:

Neutral atoms of chlorine are bombarded by high-energy photons, causing the ejection of electrons from the various filled subshells. Electrons originally from which subshell would have the highest velocity after being ejected?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. 1s
B. 2p
C. 3p
D. 3d
Answer:

A student has a liter of a 0.100 M solution of a strong acid. To prepare a buffer, this should be mixed with
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. a strong acid
B. a weak acid
C. a weak base
D. a strong base
Answer:

S(s) + O2(g) → SO2(g)
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. one atom of S reacts with one molecule of O2 to yield one molecule of SO2
B. one mole of sulfur atoms reacts with one mole of oxygen molecules to yield one mole of sulfur dioxide molecules
C. this reaction goes to completion
D. adding S(s) will change the equilibrium constant
Answer:

Which of the following is true for all bases?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. All bases donate OH- ions into solution.
B. Only strong bases create solutions in which OH- ions are present.
C. Only strong bases are good conductors when dissolved in solution.
D. For weak bases, the concentration of the OH-ions exceeds the concentration of the base in the solution.
Answer:

What is the molar mass of a monoprotic weak acid that requires 26.3 mL of 0.122 M KOH to neutralize 0.682 gram of the acid?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. 212 g mol-1
B. 4.70 g mol-1
C. 147 g mol-1
D. 682 g mol-1
Answer:

A sample of a compound known to consist of only carbon, hydrogen, and oxygen is found to have a total mass of 29.05 g. If the mass of the carbon is 18.02 g and the mass of the hydrogen is 3.03 g, what is the empirical formula of the compound?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. C2H4O
B. C3H6O
C. C2H6O3
D. C3H8O2
Answer:

Formation of a solution can often be visualized as a three-step process. Step 1. Solvent molecules are separated from each other to make space for the solute. Step 2. Solute molecules are separated so they fit into spaces in the solvent. Step 3. Separated solute and solvent are brought together, filling in the spaces. Which of the following statements about the energy involved in the above is correct?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. Steps 1 and 2 are exothermic, and step 3 is endothermic.
B. Steps 1 and 2 are endothermic, and step 3 is exothermic.
C. All three steps are exothermic.
D. All three steps are endothermic.
Answer:

A solution of a weak base is titrated with a solution of a standard strong acid. The progress of the titration is followed with a pH meter. Which of the following observations would occur?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. Initially, the pH slowly decreases, then there is a rapid decrease to give a pH below 7 at the equivalence point.
B. The pH of the solution gradually decreases throughout the experiment and the pH at the equivalence point is below 7.
C. Initially, the pH slowly decreases, then there is a rapid decrease to give a pH equal to 7 at the equivalence point.
D. Initially, the pH quickly decrease, then there is a gradual decrease to the equivalence point where the pOH equals the pKb of the base.
Answer:

The reaction of Br2(g) with Cl2(g) to form BrCl(g) has an equilibrium constant of 15.0 at a certain temperature. If 10.0 grams of BrCl is initially present in a 15.0-liter reaction vessel, what will the concentration of BrCl be at equilibrium?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. 3.8 × 10^-3 mol/L
B. 5.77 × 10^-3 mol/L
C. 1.97 × 10^-3 M
D. 9.9 × 10^-4 M
Answer:

Joseph Priestly discovered oxygen gas by the decomposition of solid mercury(II) oxide, HgO, to oxygen gas, O2, and liquid mercury metal, Hg. How many moles of oxygen gas will form when 4.32 g of solid mercury(II) oxide decomposes? The formula mass of mercury(II) oxide is 216 g mol^-1.
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. 0.100 mol
B. 0.0100 mol
C. 0.0200 mol
D. 0.0150 mol
Answer:

Of the following oxo acids, which is predicted to be the strongest acid?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. HBrO
B. HClO
C. HIO
D. HClO3
Answer:

Most transition metals share a common oxidation state of +2. Which of the following best explains why?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. Transition metals all have a minimum of two unpaired electrons.
B. Transition metals have unstable configurations and are very reactive.
C. Transition metals tend to gain electrons when reacting with other elements.
D. Transition metals will lose their outermost s-block electrons when forming bonds.
Answer:

How many moles of propane (C3H8) are there in 6.2 g of propane?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. 14.1 mol
B. 1.4 × 10^-1 mol
C. 71 mol
D. 7.1 mol
Answer:

Which of the following is not a good measure of relative intermolecular attractive forces?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. Heat of fusion
B. Boiling points
C. Vapor pressures
D. Heat of vaporization
Answer:

Which of the following is considered a metalloid?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. Cr
B. Mn
C. Si
D. S
Answer:

An ideal solution is a
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. mixture where two solvents can be dissolved in all ratios
B. mixture that has the same physical properties as the individual solvents
C. mixture where the potential energy of the mixture is the same as that of the individual solvents
D. mixture that is colorless
Answer:

Nickel (Z = 28, A = 59) has a first ionization energy of 737 kJ/mol and a boiling point of 2913 °C, while Pt (Z = 78, A = 195) has a first ionization energy of 870 kJ/mol and a boiling point of 3825 °C. Which of the following are the most reasonable values of ionization energy and boiling point for palladium?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. -200 kJ/mol and 3524 °C
B. 795 kJ/mol and 2436 °C
C. 804 kJ/mol and 2963 °C
D. 932 kJ/mol and 3416 °C
Answer:

In which of the following is the negative end of the bond written last?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. O—S
B. Br—N
C. N—C
D. P—Cl

B. Even though the sample temperature changed more than the water temperature did, the sample lost the same amount of thermal energy as the water gained.

Answer:
